page.title: 17NEW ABBEY - RELIGION
page.content: The ruin of the earliest known church is on an island on Loch Kindar. In 1273 Sweetheart Abbey was built by Lady Devorgilla on the banks of the Pow 2 miles away.This Cistercian Abbey became the centre of the religious life of the parish. A Protestant congregation came into being at the Reformation and a church was built on the cloister green.This church was replaced by the present building half a mile away in 1877. The congregation of 300 comes from the village and surrounding area. It shares its minister with the nearby congregation of Lochend as part of the national Church of Scotland. The Roman Catholic church of St Mary in the village has a small membership augmented by visitors in the summer. This church and area are served by the clergy of St Andrew's Church,Dumfries.
